alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 10:48PM EST until December 22 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Several businesses along Front Street in downtown Augusta suffer basement flooding. Water two feet deep on Bond Street near Water Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:36 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 26.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:36 PM EST Tuesday was 26.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 26.6 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening to 10.6 feet Friday morning. It will rise to 10.9 feet late Friday morning. It will then fall to 9.4 feet Friday evening. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
